entry.title: St. Martin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Late Gothic appearance of the church of St. Martin (interior pictured) in Oestrich was destroyed in the Thirty Years' War and restored only in 1894?

entry.title: Georgia Twinn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that before going viral on TikTok for "Hit or Miss" at age fifteen, Georgia Twinn wanted to become a forensic scientist?

entry.title: Shovel Knight: Specter of Torment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jake Kaufman composed most of the soundtrack for Shovel Knight: Specter of Torment while streaming on Twitch?

entry.title: Thomas Ragle (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas Ragle, the president of Marlboro College from 1958 to 1981, described his position as like a "19th-century college president"?

entry.title: Frank Duncan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that after being waived by the San Diego Chargers, Frank Duncan began packing before being re-signed the next day and eventually becoming a starter?

entry.title: Shalom chaverim (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that "Shalom chaverim" ('Peace, friends'), a Hebrew traditional folk song, has been sung at events commemorating the Holocaust and victims of anti-Semitic violence?

entry.title: Van Cortlandt House (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a future U.S. president and a future British king both visited the Van Cortlandt House during the American Revolution?

entry.title: femboys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one academic described the introduction of femboys to Myanmar as a tactic to achieve an "ideological revolution"?
